meanings.sent1: The overwearying journey left them drained and exhausted.
meanings.sent2: The overwearying task of carrying heavy boxes made her muscles ache.
meanings.sent3: After the overwearying hike, they collapsed on the grass, too tired to move.
meanings.sent4: The overwearying heat of the desert sun beat down relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The overwearying workload felt like a heavy weight on their shoulders.

meanings.definition: To make someone tired or weary.
meanings.sent1: She tried not to overwearying herself with too many chores in one day.
meanings.sent2: The long hours of work began to overwearying him, causing him to yawn frequently.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to overwearying his friends with his endless stories.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise from the construction site overwearying the residents nearby.
meanings.sent5: The monotonous task of data entry can quickly overwearying even the most diligent worker.
